sen.j: 皇極天皇（こうぎょくてんのう、推古天皇2年（594年） - 斉明天皇7年7月24日 (旧暦)（661年8月24日）は、日本の第35代天皇（在位：皇極天皇元年1月15日 (旧暦)（642年2月19日） - 4年6月14日 (旧暦)（645年7月12日））。
sen.e: Emperor Kogyoku (Kogyoku Tenno, Emperor Suiko (594) - Emperor Saimei (August24, 661) was the thirty-fifth Emperor in Japan (reign: February 19, 642 - July 12, 645).
Empress Kogyoku (594 - August24, 661) was the thirty-fifth Emperor of Japan (reign: February 19, 642 - July 12, 645).
sen.cmt: Empressに変えました。年号を削除しました。
sen.e: Empress Kogyoku (594 - August24, 661) was the thirty-fifth Emperor of Japan (reign: February 19, 642 - July 12, 645).

sen.j: 重祚して第37代 斉明天皇（さいめいてんのう、齊明天皇。
sen.e: She assumed the throne again (choso) to be the thirty-seventh Emperor Saimei (Saimei Tenno,
She assumed the throne a second time to be the thirty-seventh Empress Saimei.
sen.cmt: Againをa second timeとしました。内容に影響がないので、ローマ字表記は削除しました。
sen.e: She assumed the throne a second time to be the thirty-seventh Empress Saimei.

sen.j: 在位：斉明天皇元年1月3日 (旧暦)（655年2月14日） - 7年7月24日（661年8月24日））となる。
sen.e: reign: February 14, 655 - August 24, 661).
Reign: February 14, 655 - August 24, 661.
sen.cmt: 大文字に修正しました。不要な括弧を削除しました。
sen.e: Reign: February 14, 655 - August 24, 661.

sen.j: 推古天皇から一代おいて即位した女帝である。
sen.e: She was the Empress who was over one generation from Emperor Suiko.
She assumed the throne two generations after Empress Suiko.
She assumed the throne two generations after Empress Suiko.

sen.j: 諱は寶女王（たからのひめみこ、たからのおおきみ）。
sen.e: Her imina (personal name) was Takara no himemiko, Takara no Okimi.
Her imina (personal name) was Takara no Himemiko, also read as Takara no Okimi.
Her imina (personal name) was Takara no Himemiko, also read as Takara no Okimi.

sen.j: 和風諡号は天豊財重日足姫天皇（あめとよたからいかしひたらしひめのすめらみこと）。
sen.e: Her Japanese-style posthumous name was Ametoyotakaraikashihitarashihime no Sumeramikoto.
Her Japanese-style posthumous name was Ametoyotakaraikashihitarashihime no Sumeramikoto.
Her Japanese-style posthumous name was Ametoyotakaraikashihitarashihime no Sumeramikoto.

sen.j: 尚、諱の表記については宝皇女（たからのひめみこ）という表記が一般化しているが、これは後世の尊称による物と思われる。
sen.e: And as for the notation of imina, Takara no Himemiko is popular, but this is because of honorific title in later generations.
As for the pronunciation of her imina, Takara no Himemiko is popular – this is thought to be a title of respect that came about from later generations.
sen.cmt: Andを削除しました。Notationをpronunciationとしました。But this~の表現を変えました。
sen.e: As for the pronunciation of her imina, Takara no Himemiko is popular – this is thought to be a title of respect that came about from later generations.

tit.cmt: ピリオドを削除しました。

sen.j: 敏達天皇の子・押坂彦人大兄皇子の子・茅渟王（ちぬのおおきみ）の第一皇女。
sen.e: She was the first Princess of Chinu no Okimi, the child of Emperor Bidatsu, the child of Oshisaka no Hikohito no Oenomiko.
She was the first Princess (daughter) of Chinu no Okimi, son of Oshisaka no Hikohito no Oenomikeo, son of Emperor Bidatsu.
sen.cmt: 順序を変えました。Princessに説明としてdaughterを加えました。
sen.e: She was the first Princess (daughter) of Chinu no Okimi, son of Oshisaka no Hikohito no Oenomikeo, son of Emperor Bidatsu.

sen.j: 母は吉備姫王（きびひめのおおきみ）という。
sen.e: Her mother was called Kibitsuhime Okimi.
Her mother was called Kibitsuhime Okimi.
Her mother was called Kibitsuhime Okimi.

sen.j: はじめ高向王と結婚して、漢皇子を産んだ。
sen.e: Firstly she got married with Takamukuo and had Aya no Miko.
She first married Takamukuo and gave birth to Aya no Miko.
sen.cmt: 自然な表現にしました。
sen.e: She first married Takamukuo and gave birth to Aya no Miko.

sen.j: 後に舒明天皇の皇后として、中大兄皇子（天智天皇）・間人皇女（孝徳天皇の皇后）・大海人皇子（天武天皇）を産んだ。
sen.e: Later, as the Empress of Emperor Jomei, she had Naka no Oe no Oji (Emperor Tenchi), Hashihito no Himemiko (the Empress of Emperor Kotoku) and Prince Oama (Emperor Tenmu).
Later, as the Empress (wife) of Emperor Jomei, she gave birth to Naka no Oe no Oji (Emperor Tenchi), Hashihito no Himemiko (Empress of Emperor Kotoku) and Prince Oama (Emperor Tenmu).
sen.cmt: 上文と同じスタイルにしました。
sen.e: Later, as the Empress (wife) of Emperor Jomei, she gave birth to Naka no Oe no Oji (Emperor Tenchi), Hashihito no Himemiko (Empress of Emperor Kotoku) and Prince Oama (Emperor Tenmu).

sen.j: 舒明天皇の後、継嗣となる皇子が定まらなかったので、皇極天皇として即位した。
sen.e: After Emperor Jomei, the prince as heir was not determined and she was enthroned as Emperor Kogyoku.
After Emperor Jomei, because they could not decide on which prince should inherit the throne, she was enthroned as Empress Kogyoku.
sen.cmt: 自然な表現にしました。
sen.e: After Emperor Jomei, because they could not decide on which prince should inherit the throne, she was enthroned as Empress Kogyoku.

sen.j: 『日本書紀』によれば、天皇は古の道に従って政を行なった。
sen.e: According to "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan), Emperor administered affairs of state, following the Old Way.
sen.cmt: 「古の道」を、the Old Wayとしました。
sen.e: According to "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan), the Empress administered affairs of state according to the Old Way.
sen.cmt: コンマを削除しました。冠詞を追加しました。
sen.e: According to "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan), the Empress administered affairs of state according to the Old Way.

sen.j: 在位中は、蘇我蝦夷が大臣として重んじられ、その子・蘇我入鹿が自ら国政を執った。
sen.e: During her reign she appointed Soga no Emishi to a responsible position and the son Soga no Iruka himself took the helm of state.
During her reign she relied heavily on her minister SOGA no Emishi, and his son SOGA no Iruka himself took the helm of the state.
sen.cmt: 原文により忠実になるよう訳しました。姓を大文字にしました。
sen.e: During her reign she relied heavily on her minister SOGA no Emishi, and his son SOGA no Iruka himself took the helm of the state.

sen.j: 在位4年目（645年）に中大兄皇子が蘇我蝦夷・入鹿親子を滅ぼす（乙巳の変・大化の改新）と、皇極天皇は同母弟の軽皇子（後の孝徳天皇）に皇位を譲った（史上初の譲位）。
sen.e: In the fourth year during her reign (645), Naka no Oe no Oji exterminated the parent and child Soga no Emishi and Iruka (Isshi no hen (the Murder in the Year of Isshi), Taika no Kaishin (Great Reformation of the Taika Era)) and Emperor Kogyoku gave the Imperial throne to Prince Karu, her younger maternal half-brother (later, Emperor Kotoku) (the first abdication of the throne in history).

In the fourth year of her reign (645), Naka no Oe no Oji killed SOGA no Emishi and his son Iruka (Isshi no hen [the Murder in the Year of Isshi], Taika no Kaishin [Great Reformation of the Taika Era]) and Empress Kogyoku handed the Imperial throne over to Prince Karu, her younger maternal half-brother (later, Emperor Kotoku) (this was the first abdication of the throne in history).
sen.cmt: Duringをofにしました。Exterminateをkillにしました。親子の表現を変えました。括弧を規定通りにしました。姓を大文字にしました。
sen.e: In the fourth year of her reign (645), Naka no Oe no Oji killed SOGA no Emishi and his son Iruka (Isshi no hen [the Murder in the Year of Isshi], Taika no Kaishin [Great Reformation of the Taika Era]) and Empress Kogyoku handed the Imperial throne over to Prince Karu, her younger maternal half-brother (later, Emperor Kotoku) (this was the first abdication of the throne in history).

sen.j: 孝徳天皇により、皇祖母尊（すめみおやのみこと）の称号を奉られた。
sen.e: Emperor Kotoku gave her the title of Founders of the Imperial Family Sumemioya no Mikoto.
Emperor Kotoku gave her the title Sumemioya no Mikoto, meaning Founder of the Imperial Family.
sen.cmt: 自然な表現にしました。
sen.e: Emperor Kotoku gave her the title Sumemioya no Mikoto, meaning Founder of the Imperial Family.

sen.j: 孝徳天皇の死後、655年に再び皇位に就いた（史上初の重祚）。
sen.e: After Emperor Kotoku passed away, she assumed the throne again in 655 (the first choso in history).
In 655 after Emperor Kotoku passed away, she assumed the throne a second time (the first such occurrence in history).
sen.cmt: 自然な表現にしました。
sen.e: In 655 after Emperor Kotoku passed away, she assumed the throne a second time (the first such occurrence in history).

sen.j: 政治の実権は皇太子の中大兄皇子が執った。
sen.e: The real power was taken by the crown prince Naka no Oe no Oji.
Crown Prince Naka no Oe no Oji was the power behind the throne.
sen.cmt: 英語の決まった表現を使いました。
sen.e: Crown Prince Naka no Oe no Oji was the power behind the throne.

sen.j: 『日本書紀』によれば、しばしば工事を起こすことを好んだため、労役の重さを見た人々が批判した。
sen.e: According to "Nihonshoki" she liked to start the construction work and those who see the heaviness of royaku (labor service) criticized her.
According to "Nihonshoki" she liked to have construction work done, and was criticized by those who saw the burden to laborers.
sen.cmt: Startをdoにしました。自然な表現にしました。
sen.e: According to "Nihonshoki" she liked to have construction work done, and was criticized by those who saw the burden to laborers.

sen.j: 有間皇子の変に際して、蘇我赤兄は天皇の3つの失政を挙げた。
sen.e: On uprising of Prince Arima, Soga no Akae raised the three misgovernments by Emperor.
Upon the uprising of Prince Arima, SOGA no Akae raised the following three instances of misadministration by the Empress:
sen.cmt: 姓を大文字にしました。冠詞を追加しました。Misgovernmentをmisadministrationにしました。次の文章につながるようにしました。
sen.e: Upon the uprising of Prince Arima, SOGA no Akae raised the following three instances of misadministration by the Empress:

sen.j: 大いに倉を建てて民の財を積み集めたのが一、長く溝を掘って公糧を損費したのが二、船に石を載せて運び積んで丘にしたのが三である。
sen.e: 1. Goods of folks were piled and collected by building big storehouses, 2. Public stock paddy was wasted by digging long trenches, 3. Hills were built up by loading stones on the ship and carrying it.
1. Large storehouses were built and the citizens' property was stockpiled; 2. Long trenches were dug and public grains were wasted; 3. Stones were loaded on a ship and carried over to make a hill.
1. Large storehouses were built and the citizens' property was stockpiled; 2. Long trenches were dug and public grains were wasted; 3. Stones were loaded on a ship and carried over to make a hill.

sen.j: 対外的には、朝鮮半島の諸国と使者を交換し、唐にも使者を遣わした。
sen.e: Externally she exchanged the envoys with each country in Korean peninsula and sent the envoy to Tang dynasty.
Externally she exchanged envoys with the kingdoms in the Korean peninsula and sent an envoy to Tang (China).
sen.cmt: Countryをkingdomにしました。冠詞を削除しました。冠詞を変えました。Dynastyを削除しました。
sen.e: Externally she exchanged envoys with the kingdoms in the Korean peninsula and sent an envoy to Tang (China).

sen.j: 蝦夷に対し、三度にわたって阿倍比羅夫を海路の遠征に送った。
sen.e: She sent ABE no Hirafu by sea route to Ezo (northerners) three times.
She sent ABE no Hirafu by sea to Ezo (northern Japan) three times.
sen.cmt: 蝦夷を地としました。Routeを削除しました。
sen.e: She sent ABE no Hirafu by sea to Ezo (northern Japan) three times.

sen.j: 在位5年（660年）に百済が唐と新羅によって滅ぼされた。
sen.e: In her fifth year of reign (660) Kudara (Paekche) was defeated by Tang dynasty and Shiragi (ancient Korean kingdom).
In her fifth year of reign (660) Baekje was defeated by Tang and Silla.
sen.cmt: 英語版wikipediaと名称を合わせました。日本語に説明がないので、英語からも削除しました。
sen.e: In her fifth year of reign (660) Baekje was defeated by Tang and Silla.

sen.j: 百済の滅亡と遺民の抗戦を知ると、人質として日本に滞在していた百済王子扶余豊璋を百済に送った。
sen.e: Knowing the fall of Kudara and the resistance of the people left (the people keeping old traditions after the fall of the dynasty they belonged to), she sent King of Paekche Buyeo Pung, who was staying in Japan as a hostage, to Kudara.

Hearing of the fall of Baekje and the resistance of the people left (those keeping old traditions after the fall of their dynasty), she sent Buyeo Pung, the prince of Baekje who was staying in Japan as a hostage, back to Baekje.
sen.cmt: Knowingをhearing ofにしました。Kingをprinceにしました。
sen.e: Hearing of the fall of Baekje and the resistance of the people left (those keeping old traditions after the fall of their dynasty), she sent Buyeo Pung, the prince of Baekje who was staying in Japan as a hostage, back to Baekje.

sen.j: 百済を援けるため、難波に遷って武器と船舶を作らせ、更に瀬戸内海を西に渡り、筑紫国の朝倉宮に居て戦争に備えた。
sen.e: To support Kudara, she ordered them to make weapons and ships in Namba and furthermore moved westward through Seto Inland Sea and prepared for the war staying in Asakura Palace in Tsukushi Province.

To support Baekje, she travelled to Namba and commissioned ships and arms to be prepared, then travelled further west across the Seto Inland Sea, staying in Asakura Palace in Tsukushi Province to prepare for war.
sen.cmt: 自然な表現にしました。
sen.e: To support Baekje, she travelled to Namba and commissioned ships and arms to be prepared, then travelled further west across the Seto Inland Sea, staying in Asakura Palace in Tsukushi Province to prepare for war.

sen.j: 遠征の軍が発する前に亡くなった。
sen.e: Before the expedition left, she passed away.
She died before the military departed on the expedition.
sen.cmt: 自然な表現にしました。
sen.e: She died before the military departed on the expedition.

sen.j: 皇極・斉明天皇の年譜
sen.e: Chronological list of the main events of Emperor Kogyoku and Saimei.
Chronological List of Major Events for Empress Kogyoku and Saimei
sen.cmt: タイトルなので大文字にしました。
sen.e: Chronological List of Major Events for Empress Kogyoku and Saimei

tit.cmt: ピリオドを削除しました。

sen.e: - Married with Takamukuo.
- Married Takamukuo.
- Married Takamukuo.

sen.j: 舒明天皇2年（630年）
sen.e: Emperor Jomei 2 (630).

tit.cmt: ピリオドを削除しました。

sen.j: - 舒明天皇の皇后に立てられる。
sen.e: - Appointed to the Empress of Emperor Jomei.
- Appointed the Empress of Emperor Jomei.
- Appointed the Empress of Emperor Jomei.

sen.j: 舒明天皇13年（641年）
sen.e: Emperor Jomei 13 (641).

tit.cmt: ピリオドを削除しました。

sen.j: - 舒明天皇が崩御。
sen.e: - Emperor Jomei passed away.
- Emperor Jomei passed away.
- Emperor Jomei passed away.

sen.j: 皇極天皇元年（642年）
sen.e: The first year of Emperor Kogyoku (642).

tit.cmt: ピリオドを削除しました。

sen.j: - 即位。
sen.e: - Enthronement.
- Assumed the throne.
sen.cmt: 自然な表現にしました。
sen.e: - Assumed the throne.

tit.cmt: ピリオドを削除しました。

sen.j: - 阿曇比羅夫が百済の弔使を伴って帰国。
sen.e: - Azumi no Hirafu came back to Japan with Kudara's envoy for the dead.
sen.cmt: 「弔使」を、envoy for the deadとしました。
sen.e: - Azumi no Hirafu returned to Japan with Baekje's envoy for the dead.
- Azumi no Hirafu returned to Japan with Baekje's envoy for the dead.

tit.cmt: ピリオドを削除しました。

sen.j: - 追放された百済の王族、翹岐が従者を伴い来日。
sen.e: - Gyoki, expelled royal family in Kurada, came to Japan with the attendants.
- Gyoki, an expelled member of the royal family from Baekje, came to Japan accompanied by attendants.
sen.cmt: 自然な表現にしました。
sen.e: - Gyoki, an expelled member of the royal family from Baekje, came to Japan accompanied by attendants.

tit.cmt: ピリオドを削除しました。

sen.j: - 蘇我蝦夷が雨乞いのため大乗経典を転読させたが、微雨のみで効果がなかったため29日にやめる。
sen.e: - Soga no Emishi made them to skim through Mahayana Sutra for praying for rain, but it rained a little and had no effect and thus stopped it on 29.
- SOGA no Emishi commissioned a reading of the Mahayana Sutra in order to encourage rain, but it had little effect and rained only slightly, causing him to stop the activity on July 29.
sen.cmt: 目的語の対象が分からないので、themを削除して表現を変えました。月を追加しました。
sen.e: - SOGA no Emishi commissioned a reading of the Mahayana Sutra in order to encourage rain, but it had little effect and rained only slightly, causing him to stop the activity on July 29.

tit.cmt: ピリオドを削除しました。

sen.j: - 天皇が天に祈ると、雷が鳴って大雨が降る。
sen.e: - Emperor prayed for the sky and it thundered and rained heavily.
- The Empress prayed to the heavens, and it thundered and rained heavily.
- The Empress prayed to the heavens, and it thundered and rained heavily.

sen.j: 雨は五日間続いた。
sen.e: Rain continued for five days.
The rain continued for five days.
The rain continued for five days.

tit.cmt: ピリオドを削除しました。

sen.j: - 百済大寺の建立と船舶の建造を命じる。
sen.e: - She ordered the erection of Kudara daiji Temple and building of ships.
- Commissioned the erection of Kudara-daiji Temple and the building of ships.
sen.cmt: 主語を削除しました。お寺の英語の名称を神社仏閣のファイルと統一しました。OrderedをCommissionedにしました。
sen.e: - Commissioned the erection of Kudara-daiji Temple and the building of ships.

tit.cmt: ピリオドを削除しました。

sen.j: - 宮室を造ることを命じる。
sen.e: - She ordered the palace to be established.
- Commissioned the palace to be built.
sen.cmt: 主語を削除しました。OrderedをCommissionedにしました。
sen.e: - Commissioned the palace to be built.

tit.cmt: ピリオドを削除しました。

sen.j: - 小墾田宮に遷る。
sen.e: - She moved to Oharida-no-miya (Oharida Palace).
- Moved to Oharida-no-miya (Oharida Palace).
- Moved to Oharida-no-miya (Oharida Palace).

sen.j: 皇極天皇2年（643年）
sen.e: Emperor Kogyoku 2 (643).

tit.cmt: ピリオドを削除しました。

sen.j: - 蘇我入鹿が山背大兄王を攻め、数日後に王は自殺。
sen.e: - Soga no Iruka attacked Prince Yamashiro no oe and a few days later Prince committed suicide.
- SOGA no Iruka attacked Prince Yamashiro no oe, and a few days later the prince committed suicide.
sen.cmt: 氏を大文字にしました。冠詞を追加しました。
sen.e: - SOGA no Iruka attacked Prince Yamashiro no oe, and a few days later the prince committed suicide.

sen.j: 皇極天皇4年（645年）
sen.e: Emperor Kogyoku 4 (645).

tit.cmt: ピリオドを削除しました。

sen.j: - 中大兄皇子らが宮中で蘇我入鹿を殺す。
sen.e: - Naka no Oe no Oji and so on killed Soga no Iruka in the imperial court.
- Naka no Oe no Oji and others killed SOGA no Iruka in the imperial court.
sen.cmt: So onをOthersにしました。氏を大文字にしました。
sen.e: - Naka no Oe no Oji and others killed SOGA no Iruka in the imperial court.

sen.j: （乙巳の変）
sen.e: Isshi no hen.
(Isshi no hen)
(Isshi no hen)

- SOGA no Emishi committed suicide.
sen.cmt: 氏を大文字にしました。
sen.e: - SOGA no Emishi committed suicide.

tit.cmt: ピリオドを削除しました。

sen.j: - 軽皇子に譲位。
sen.e: - The Imperial throne was transferred to Prince Karu.
- The Imperial throne was transferred to Prince Karu.
- The Imperial throne was transferred to Prince Karu.

sen.j: 新しい天皇により、皇祖母尊の称号を奉られる。
sen.e: The title of Founders of the Imperial Family Sumemioya no Mikoto was given to her by the new Emperor.
Received the title Sumemioya no Mikoto from the new emperor.

sen.j: 白雉2年（651年）
sen.e: Hakuchi 2 (651)

tit.cmt: ピリオドを削除しました。

sen.j: - 十師たちを呼んで設斎。
sen.e: - She had a vegetarian diet with ten preceptors.
- Ate a vegetarian meal with ten preceptors.
sen.cmt: 主語を削除しました。Dietをmealとしました。

sen.j: - 中大兄皇子と共に,孝徳天皇を捨てて倭飛鳥河辺行宮に移る。
sen.e: - She moved to Yamato no Asuka no Kawara no Karimiya Palace with Naka no Oe no Oji, abandoning Emperor Kotoku.
- Moved to Yamato no Asuka no Kawara no Karimiya Palace with Naka no Oe no Oji, abandoning Emperor Kotoku.
- Moved to Yamato no Asuka no Kawara no Karimiya Palace with Naka no Oe no Oji, abandoning Emperor Kotoku.

- Went to Naniwanagara no Toyosaki no miya Palace with Naka no Oe no Oji to visit Emperor Kotoku who had fallen ill.

sen.j: 斉明天皇元年（655年）
sen.e: The first year of Emperor Saimei (655)

tit.cmt: ピリオドを削除しました。

sen.j: - 板蓋宮で再び即位（重祚）。
sen.e: - She assumed the throne again (choso) in tabuki no miya Imperial residence.
- Assumed the throne a second time at Itabuki no miya Imperial residence.
sen.cmt: 主語を削除しました。Againをa second timeにしました。綴りを直しました。Inをatに変えました。
sen.e: - Assumed the throne a second time at Itabuki no miya Imperial residence.

tit.cmt: ピリオドを削除しました。

sen.j: - 北の蝦夷99人・東の蝦夷95人・百済の調使150人に饗応する。
sen.e: - She wined and dined 99 Ezo (northerners) of the north, 95 Ezo of the east and 150 Kudara's envoy.
- She wined and dined 99 Ezo people of the north, 95 Ezo people of the east and 150 belonging to Baekje's envoy.
- She wined and dined 99 Ezo people of the north, 95 Ezo people of the east and 150 belonging to Baekje's envoy.

tit.cmt: ピリオドを削除しました。

sen.j: - 河辺麻呂が大唐から帰国。
sen.e: - Kawabe no Maro came back to Japan from the Great Tang.
- KAWABE no Maro returned to Japan from the Great Tang.
sen.cmt: 氏を大文字にしました。Came backをreturnedにしました。
sen.e: - KAWABE no Maro returned to Japan from the Great Tang.

tit.cmt: ピリオドを削除しました。

sen.j: - 小墾田に宮を造ろうとしたが,中止。
sen.e: - She tried to build a palace in Oharida, but cancelled.
- Attempted to build a palace in Oharida, but aborted.
sen.cmt: 主語を削除しました。Triedをattemptedにしました。Cancelledをabortedにしました。
sen.e: - Attempted to build a palace in Oharida, but aborted.

sen.j: 冬
sen.e: Winter.
Winter
sen.cmt: ピリオドを削除しました。
sen.e: Winter

sen.j: - 飛鳥板蓋宮が火災に遭ったため、川原宮に遷る。
sen.e: - Asuka Itabuki no Miya palace caught fire and thus she moved to Kawahara no Miya (Kawahara Palace).
- Moved to Kawahara no Miya Palace after Asuka Itabuki no Miya Palace caught fire.
sen.cmt: 英語名称を統一しました。主語を削除しました。
sen.e: - Moved to Kawahara no Miya Palace after Asuka Itabuki no Miya Palace caught fire.

sen.j: この年
sen.e: This year.
Other Events this Year
sen.cmt: セクションのタイトルとして分かりやすい言葉にしました。
sen.e: Other Events this Year

sen.j: 高句麗、百済、新羅が使を遣わして調を進める。
sen.e: Goguryeo (kingdom of Korea), Kudara and Shiragi (ancient Korean kingdom) sent envoys and advanced the survey.
Goguryeo, Baekje and Silla (Three Kingdoms of Korea) sent envoys to proceed with their survey.
sen.cmt: 英語版wikipediaと名称を合わせました。Advancedをproceedとしました。
sen.e: Goguryeo, Baekje and Silla (Three Kingdoms of Korea) sent envoys to proceed with their survey.

sen.j: 百済の大使は余宜受、副使は調信仁で、総員は100余人であった。
sen.e: The taishi (commander-in-chief) of Kudara was Yogiju and the vice commander was Choshinjin and the number of them was about 100.
sen.cmt: 「余宜受」、「調信仁」、読み方不明のため、YogijuとChoshinjinとしておきました。
sen.e: There were over 100 people in the envoy for Baekje, led by Commander-in-Chief Yogiju and Vice Commander Choshinjin.
sen.cmt: 自然な表現にしました。
sen.e: There were over 100 people in the envoy for Baekje, led by Commander-in-Chief Yogiju and Vice Commander Choshinjin.

sen.j: 蝦夷と隼人が衆を率いて内属し、朝献する。
sen.e: Ezo and Hayato (an ancient tribe in Kyushu) led the folks and belonged to Kudara with bringing tribute.
Ezo and Hayato (an ancient tribe in Kyushu) led their people to pledge their loyalty to the empire, and brought tributes.
sen.cmt: 内容が原文と異なっていました。
sen.e: Ezo and Hayato (an ancient tribe in Kyushu) led their people to pledge their loyalty to the empire, and brought tributes.

sen.j: 新羅は弥武を人質にし、別に12人を才伎人にしたが、弥武は病死。
sen.e: Shiragi caught Yabu in a hostage situation and made twelve persons saigijin differently, but Yabu died of sickness.
Silla took Yabu hostage and made another 12 saigijin, but Yabu died of sickness.
sen.cmt: Caught~をtook hostage~にしました。才技人が不明です。１２人とは別の人質と解釈しました。
sen.e: Silla took Yabu hostage and made another 12 saigijin, but Yabu died of sickness.

sen.j: 斉明天皇2年（656年）
sen.e: Emperor Saimei 2 (656).

tit.cmt: ピリオドを削除しました。

sen.j: - 高句麗が大使に達沙、副使に伊利之、総計81人を遣わし、調を進める。
sen.e: - Goguryeo sent 81 people, including Tatsusa as taishi, Irino as a vice commander, and advanced the survey.
- Goguryeo sent an envoy of 81 people, led by Commander-in-Chief Tatsusa and Vice Commander Irino in order to advanced their survey.
sen.cmt: 自然な表現にしました。
sen.e: - Goguryeo sent an envoy of 81 people, led by Commander-in-Chief Tatsusa and Vice Commander Irino in order to advanced their survey.

tit.cmt: ピリオドを削除しました。

sen.j: - 高句麗に,大使に膳葉積,副使に坂合部磐鍬以下の使を遣わす。
sen.e: - She sent Zenhatsumi as taishi, Sakaibe no ihasuki as a vice commander and the followers to Goguryeo.
- Sent an envoy to Goguryeo led by Commander-in-Chief Zenhatsumi and Vice Commander SAKAIBE no Ihasuki, accompanied by their followers.
sen.cmt: 他の似た文章と同じようにしました。原文の句読点がコンマになっています。
sen.e: - Sent an envoy to Goguryeo led by Commander-in-Chief Zenhatsumi and Vice Commander SAKAIBE no Ihasuki, accompanied by their followers.

sen.j: この年
sen.e: This year.
Other Events this Year
sen.cmt: セクションのタイトルとして分かりやすい言葉にしました。
sen.e: Other Events this Year

sen.j: 飛鳥の岡本に宮を造り始める。
sen.e: She began to build a palace in Okamoto, Asuka.
Began to build a palace in Okamoto, Asuka.
Began to build a palace in Okamoto, Asuka.

sen.j: 途中、高句麗、百済、新羅が使を遣わして調を進めたため、紺の幕を張って饗応する。
sen.e: On the way, Goguryeo, Kudara and Shiragi sent envoys and advanced the survey and she wined and dined them, curtaining mazarine shroud.
During the construction Goguryeo, Baekje and Silla sent envoys to proceed with their surveys, so she entertained them behind navy blue curtains.
sen.cmt: 訳文が理解不可能でした。
sen.e: During the construction Goguryeo, Baekje and Silla sent envoys to proceed with their surveys, so she entertained them behind navy blue curtains.

sen.j: やがて宮室が建ったので、そこに遷って岡本宮と名付ける。
sen.e: At last the palace was established and she moved there and named it Okamoto Palace.
Eventually the palace was completed, and she moved in and named it Okamoto Palace.
sen.cmt: 自然な表現にしました。
sen.e: Eventually the palace was completed, and she moved in and named it Okamoto Palace.

sen.j: 岡本宮が火災に遭う。
sen.e: Okamoto Palace caught fire.
Okamoto Palace caught fire.
Okamoto Palace caught fire.

sen.j: 香山の西から石上山まで溝を掘り、舟で石を運んで垣を造る。
sen.e: She made them dig a ditch from the west of Kaguyama (Mt. Kaguyama) to Ishi-no-kamiyama (Mt. Ishi-no-kamiyama) and carry stones on ships to make barrier.
A trench was dug from the west of Mount Kagu-yama to Mount Ishi-no-kamiyama, and stones were carried on ships to build barriers.
sen.cmt: 山の名称を規定に合わせました。主語を削除し、受け身の文章にしました。
sen.e: A trench was dug from the west of Mount Kagu-yama to Mount Ishi-no-kamiyama, and stones were carried on ships to build barriers.

sen.j: 吉野宮を作る。
sen.e: She made Yoshino no miya palace.
Yoshino no Miya Palace was built.
sen.cmt: 自然にするため意訳しました。
sen.e: Yoshino no Miya Palace was built.

sen.j: 西海使の佐伯栲縄と吉士国勝らが百済より還って、鸚鵡を献上する。
sen.e: Takunawa SAEKI and Kunikatsu YOSHIDO of Saikaishi (ombudsman of Saikai area) came back to Japan from Kudara and presented a parrot.
Ambassadors for the western seacoast Takunawa SAEKI and Kunikatsu YOSHIDO returned from Baekje and presented a parrot.
sen.cmt: ローマ字表記を英語に変えました。
sen.e: Ambassadors for the western seacoast Takunawa SAEKI and Kunikatsu YOSHIDO returned from Baekje and presented a parrot.

sen.j: 斉明天皇3年（657年）
sen.e: Emperor Saimei 3 (657).

tit.cmt: ピリオドを削除しました。

sen.j: - 吐火羅国（とからのくに）の男2人・女4人が筑紫に漂着したので、召す。
sen.e: - Two men and four women from Tokarakoku (Tokara Province) drifted down to Chikushi and she made them serve.
- Two men and four women from Tokara Province (current Kagoshima) drifted ashore at Chikushi and were put into her service.
sen.cmt: ローマ字表記を削除しました。Drift downをdrift ashoreとしました。She made~の表現を変えました。
sen.e: - Two men and four women from Tokara Province (current Kagoshima) drifted ashore at Chikushi and were put into her service.

tit.cmt: ピリオドを削除しました。

sen.j: - 須弥山の像を飛鳥寺の西に造り、盂蘭盆会を行なった。
sen.e: - She made the statue of Mt. Sumeru in the west of Asuka-dera Temple and held Urabon-e festival (a Festival of the Dead or Buddhist All Souls' Day, around the 15th of July or August, depending on local customs).
- Had a statue of Mt Sumeru built to the west of Asuka-dera Temple, and held a Urabon-e festival (Festival of the Dead).
sen.cmt: 主語を削除しました。説明を省略しました。
sen.e: - Had a statue of Mt Sumeru built to the west of Asuka-dera Temple, and held a Urabon-e festival (Festival of the Dead).

sen.j: 暮に覩貨邏人を饗応する。
sen.e: She wined and dined Tokara people in the end of the year.
- Entertained the Tokara people at the end of the year.
sen.cmt: Wine and dineをentertainにしました。Inをatにしました。
sen.e: - Entertained the Tokara people at the end of the year.

tit.cmt: ピリオドを削除しました。

sen.j: - 有間皇子が狂を装い,牟婁温湯に行き,帰って景勝を賞賛した。
sen.e: - Prince Arima disguised with madness, went to Muro hot spring and admired the scenic area.
- Prince Arima disguised with madness, went to Muro hot spring and admired the scenic area.
- Prince Arima disguised with madness, went to Muro hot spring and admired the scenic area.

sen.j: 天皇はこれを聞いて悦び、行って観たいと思う。
sen.e: Emperor was glad to hear this and wished to go there.
Happy to hear of this, the empress thought she would like to go see it for herself.
sen.cmt: 原文により忠実になるよう訳しました。
sen.e: Happy to hear of this, the empress thought she would like to go see it for herself.

tit.cmt: セクションのタイトルとして分かりやすい言葉にしました。

sen.j: - 使を新羅に遣って,僧の智達・間人御厩・依網稚子らを新羅の使に付けて大唐に送ってほしいと告げる。
sen.e: - She sent the envoys to Shiragi in order for the priests Chitatsu, Taiza, Miumaya, Yosami no wakugo and so on to be sent to Great Tang with Shiragi's envoys.
- Sent an envoy to Silla to convey her desire for priests including Chitatsu, Taiza Miumaya, YOSAMI no Wakugo to be sent to Great Tang with Silla's envoy.
sen.cmt: 主語を削除しました。僧の名前を修正しました。内容が原文と異なっていました。
sen.e: - Sent an envoy to Silla to convey her desire for priests including Chitatsu, Taiza Miumaya, YOSAMI no Wakugo to be sent to Great Tang with Silla's envoy.

sen.j: 新羅が受け入れなかったので、智達らは帰国。
sen.e: Shiragi did not accept this and thus Chitatsu and so on returned to Japan.
Silla disagreed, so Chitatsu and the others returned to Japan.
sen.cmt: And so onをothersにしました。Not acceptをdisagreeにしました。Thusをsoにしました。
sen.e: Silla disagreed, so Chitatsu and the others returned to Japan.

sen.j: 斉明天皇4年（658年）
sen.e: Emperor Saimei 4 (658).

tit.cmt: ピリオドを削除しました。

sen.j: - 左大臣巨勢徳太が死去。
sen.e: - Sadaijin (Minister of the left) KOSE no Tokuta died.
- Sadaijin (Minister of the left) KOSE no Tokuta died.
- Sadaijin (Minister of the left) KOSE no Tokuta died.

tit.cmt: ピリオドを削除しました。

sen.j: - 阿倍比羅夫が蝦夷に遠征する。
sen.e: - ABE no Hirafu made an expedition to Ezo.
- ABE no Hirafu made an expedition to Ezo.
- ABE no Hirafu made an expedition to Ezo.

sen.j: 降伏した蝦夷の恩荷を山本郡・津軽郡二郡の郡領に定め、有馬浜で渡島国の蝦夷を饗応する。
sen.e: OGA of Ezo who surrendered was appointed to Gunryo (hereditary district magistrate) of two gun, Yamamoto gun and Tsugaru gun, by her, and she wined and dined Ezo in Oshima Province in Arima beach.
Appointed OGA of Ezo, who had surrendered, to the position of Gunryo (district magistrate) of two counties – Yamamoto and Tsugaru – and entertained the Ezo people of Oshima Province at Arima beach.
sen.cmt: 主語を削除しました。Wine and dineをentertainにしました。時制を修正しました。郡をcountyと訳しました。Inをatに変えました。
sen.e: Appointed OGA of Ezo, who had surrendered, to the position of Gunryo (district magistrate) of two counties – Yamamoto and Tsugaru – and entertained the Ezo people of Oshima Province at Arima beach.

tit.cmt: ピリオドを削除しました。

sen.j: - 皇孫の建皇子が8歳で亡くなる。
sen.e: - The imperial descendant Takeru no miko passed away at the age of eight.
- The imperial descendant Takeru no miko passed away at the age of eight.
- The imperial descendant Takeru no miko passed away at the age of eight.

sen.j: 天皇は甚だ哀しんだ。
sen.e: Emperor lamented over so much.
The empress was overcome with grief.
The empress was overcome with grief.

tit.cmt: ピリオドを削除しました。

sen.j: - 蝦夷二百余が朝献する。
sen.e: - About 200 Ezo brought tributes.
- About 200 Ezo people brought tributes.
- About 200 Ezo people brought tributes.

sen.j: 常よりも厚く饗応し、位階を授け、物を与える。
sen.e: She wined and dined them more than usual and gave them Ikai (Court rank) and goods.
Entertained them more than usual and gave them Ikai (Court rank) and goods.
sen.cmt: 主語を削除しました。Wine and dineをentertainにしました。
sen.e: Entertained them more than usual and gave them Ikai (Court rank) and goods.

tit.cmt: ピリオドを削除しました。

sen.j: - 僧の智通と智達が勅を受けて新羅の船に乗って大唐国に行き、玄奘法師から無性衆生義（法相宗）を受ける。
sen.e: - The priest Chitsu and Chitatsu were given the imperial decree to get on the ship of Shiragi and go to Great Tang, and they accepted Mushoshujogi (Hosso sect) from Xuanzang hoshi (Buddhist priest).

Receiving an Imperial decree, the priests Chitsu and Chitatsu travelled to Great Tang on Silla's ship and received the teachings of Xuanzang Hoshi (Buddhist priest) regarding asexual life (Hosso sect).

Receiving an Imperial decree, the priests Chitsu and Chitatsu travelled to Great Tang on Silla's ship and received the teachings of Xuanzang Hoshi (Buddhist priest) regarding asexual life (Hosso sect).

tit.cmt: ピリオドを削除しました。

sen.j: - 紀温湯に行く。
sen.e: - She went to Kinoyu (Kino hot-spring).
- Went to Kinoyu (Kino hot-spring).
- Went to Kinoyu (Kino hot-spring).

tit.cmt: ピリオドを削除しました。

sen.j: - 蘇我赤兄が有間皇子の謀反を通報。
sen.e: - Soga no Akae reported the rebellion of Prince Arima.
- SOGA no Akae reported the rebellion of Prince Arima.
sen.cmt: 氏を大文字にしました。
sen.e: - SOGA no Akae reported the rebellion of Prince Arima.

tit.cmt: ピリオドを削除しました。

sen.j: - 有間皇子を絞首刑に、塩屋鯯肴と新田部米麻呂を斬刑にする。
sen.e: - Prince Arima was executed by hanging and Shioya and NIITABE no Yonemaro were beheaded.
sen.cmt: 「塩屋鯯肴」、読み方不明でした。
sen.e: - Prince Arima was executed by hanging and SHIOYA Seiko and NIITABE no Yonemaro were beheaded.
sen.cmt: 塩屋鯯肴の読み方は不明でした。
sen.e: - Prince Arima was executed by hanging and SHIOYA Seiko and NIITABE no Yonemaro were beheaded.

tit.cmt: セクションのタイトルとして分かりやすい言葉にしました。

sen.j: - 沙門の智喩が指南車を作る。
sen.e: - Shamon (priest) Chiyu made shinansha (ancient Chinese vehicle with a compass whose needle always pointed south).
- Shamon (priest) Chiyu made a shinansha (ancient Chinese vehicle with a compass whose needle always pointed south).
- Shamon (priest) Chiyu made a shinansha (ancient Chinese vehicle with a compass whose needle always pointed south).

sen.j: 斉明天皇5年（659年）
sen.e: Emperor Saimei 5 (659).

tit.cmt: ピリオドを削除しました。

sen.j: - 紀温湯から帰る。
sen.e: - She went back from Kinoyu.
- Returned from Kinoyu.
sen.cmt: 主語を削除しました。Go backをreturnにしました。
sen.e: - Returned from Kinoyu.

tit.cmt: ピリオドを削除しました。

sen.j: - 吉野に行く。
sen.e: - She went to Yoshino.
- Went to Yoshino.
- Went to Yoshino.

tit.cmt: ピリオドを削除しました。

sen.j: - 近江国の平浦に行く。
sen.e: - She went to Hiraura in Omi Province.
- Went to Hiraura in Omi Province.
- Went to Hiraura in Omi Province.

tit.cmt: ピリオドを削除しました。

sen.j: - 吐火羅人が妻の舎衛婦人と共に来る。
sen.e: - Tokara man came with his wife Mrs. Shae.
- A man from Tokara came with his wife Lady Shae.
sen.cmt: Tokara manをa man from Tokaraにしました。MrsをLadyにしました。
sen.e: - A man from Tokara came with his wife Lady Shae.

tit.cmt: ピリオドを削除しました。

sen.j: - 甘檮丘の東の川辺に須弥山を造って陸奥国と越国の蝦夷に饗応する。
sen.e: - She built Mt. Sumeru at the east riverside of Amakashi no oka Hill and wined and dined Ezo in Mutsu Province and Koshi Province.
- Built Mt. Sumeru at the riverside to the east of Amakashi no oka Hill and entertained the Ezo people in Mutsu and Koshi Provinces.
sen.cmt: Eastを移動しました。Wine and dineをentertainにしました。Peopleを追加しました。Provinceを削除しました。
sen.e: - Built Mt. Sumeru at the riverside to the east of Amakashi no oka Hill and entertained the Ezo people in Mutsu and Koshi Provinces.

tit.cmt: ピリオドを削除しました。

sen.j: - 阿倍比羅夫に蝦夷国を討たせる。
sen.e: - She made ABE no Hirafu attack Ezo Province.
- Ordered ABE no Hirafu to attack Ezo Province.
sen.cmt: 主語を削除しました。Madeをordered toにしました。
sen.e: - Ordered ABE no Hirafu to attack Ezo Province.

sen.j: 阿倍は一つの場所に秋田郡・渟代二郡の蝦夷241人とその虜31人、津軽郡の蝦夷112人とその虜4人、胆振国の蝦夷20人を集めて饗応し禄を与える。
sen.e: ABE gathered 241 Ezo people in Akita gun, Nushiro Kohori, the slave 31 people, 112 Ezo people in Tsugaru gun, the slave 4 people and 20 Ezo people in Iburi Province and wined and dined them and gave them salary.

ABE gathered 241 Ezo people from Akita County and the two Nushiro counties and their 31 slaves, 112 Ezo people from Tsugaru County and their four slaves as well as 20 Ezo people from Iburi Province all in once place and entertained them and gave them salaries.
sen.cmt: 内容が原文と異なっていました。
sen.e: ABE gathered 241 Ezo people from Akita County and the two Nushiro counties and their 31 slaves, 112 Ezo people from Tsugaru County and their four slaves as well as 20 Ezo people from Iburi Province all in once place and entertained them and gave them salaries.

sen.j: 後方羊蹄に郡領を置く。
sen.e: She put Gunryo in Shiribeshi.
A Gunryo was placed behind them in Shiribeshi.
sen.cmt: 主語を削除しました。原文により忠実になるようにしました。
sen.e: A Gunryo was placed behind them in Shiribeshi.

sen.j: 粛慎日本と戦って帰り、虜49人を献じる。
sen.e: Mishihase fought with Japan, went back and presented 49 slaves.
ABE fought with Mishihase Japan and returned with 49 slaves to be presented.
sen.cmt: 原文通りに訳しました。
sen.e: ABE fought with Mishihase Japan and returned with 49 slaves to be presented.

tit.cmt: ピリオドを削除しました。

sen.j: - 坂合部石布と津守吉祥を唐国に遣わす。
sen.e: - She sent SAKAIBE no iwashiki and TSUMORI no saki to Tang.
- Sent SAKAIBE no Iwashiki and TSUMORI no Saki to Tang.
sen.cmt: 名前を大文字に変えました。
sen.e: - Sent SAKAIBE no Iwashiki and TSUMORI no Saki to Tang.

tit.cmt: ピリオドを削除しました。

sen.j: - 群臣に詔して、京の内の寺に盂蘭盆経を説かせ、七世の父母に報いさせる。
sen.e: - She gave the imperial edict to a crowd or large number of one's retainers or subjects, preached Urabon-kyo Sutra to them and made them reward their fathers and mothers of the seven generations.
- Gave the imperial edict to a crowd of her subjects, had the Urabon-kyo Sutra preached to them by a temple within the capital and made them give offerings to seven generations of ancestors.
sen.cmt: 内容が原文と異なっていました。報うをgive offerings toと訳しました。
sen.e: - Gave the imperial edict to a crowd of her subjects, had the Urabon-kyo Sutra preached to them by a temple within the capital and made them give offerings to seven generations of ancestors.

sen.j: 斉明天皇6年（660年）
sen.e: Emperor Saimei 6 (660).

tit.cmt: ピリオドを削除しました。

sen.j: - 高句麗の使者、賀取文ら百人余が筑紫に着く。
sen.e: - About 100 people of the envoy from Goguryeo and Gaesomun arrived at Chikushi.
- An envoy from Goguryeo of approximately 100 people led by Gaesomun arrived at Chikushi.
sen.cmt: Envoyの使い方を修正しました。
sen.e: - An envoy from Goguryeo of approximately 100 people led by Gaesomun arrived at Chikushi.

tit.cmt: ピリオドを削除しました。

sen.j: - 阿倍比羅夫に粛慎を討たせる。
sen.e: - She made ABE no Hirafu defeat Mishihase.
- Ordered ABE no Hirafu to attack the Mishihase people.
sen.cmt: Madeをordered toにしました。Defeatをattackにしました。The Mishihase peopleとしました。
sen.e: - Ordered ABE no Hirafu to attack the Mishihase people.

sen.j: 比羅夫は、大河のほとりで粛慎に攻められた渡島の蝦夷に助けを求められる。
sen.e: Hirafu was asked for help by Ezo in Watari island (old name for Hokkaido), who were attacked by Mishihase at the riverside of Okawa.
Hirafu was asked for help by some Ezo people from Watari Island (current Hokkaido) who had been attacked by the Mishihase at the side of Okawa River.
sen.cmt: 内容が原文と異なっていました。
sen.e: Hirafu was asked for help by some Ezo people from Watari Island (current Hokkaido) who had been attacked by the Mishihase at the side of Okawa River.

sen.j: 比羅夫は粛慎を奥尻島まで追って彼らと戦い、これを破る。
sen.e: Hifafu ran after Mishihase and fought with them as far as Okushiri Island and defeated them.
Hirafu chased the Mishihase to Okushiri Island and fought and defeated his adversaries.
sen.cmt: 内容が原文と異なっていました。
sen.e: Hirafu chased the Mishihase to Okushiri Island and fought and defeated his adversaries.

tit.cmt: ピリオドを削除しました。

sen.j: - 賀取文らが難波館に到着。
sen.e: - Gaesomun and so on arrived at Naniwa-no-murotsumi (Naniwa Lodge).
- Gaesomun and others arrived at Naniwa-no-murotsumi (Naniwa Lodge).
- Gaesomun and others arrived at Naniwa-no-murotsumi (Naniwa Lodge).

sen.j: 5月
sen.e: May.
May
sen.cmt: ピリオドを削除しました。
sen.e: May

sen.j: 勅して百の高座と百の納袈裟を作り、仁王会を行う。
sen.e: She gave the imperial edict to make one hundred Koza (the stage on which a rakugo storyteller sits) and kesa (Buddhist stole) and held ninno-e (the most important official ceremonies of the [Kamakura] bakufu held at the Tsurugaoka Hachimangu).

Gave the imperial edict to build one hundred Koza (the stage on which a rakugo storyteller sits) and prepare one hundred nokesa (Buddhist stole), and held ninno-e (Buddhist ceremony of lecturing Ninnogyo [the Sutra of Benevolent Kings] to keep the nation tranquil).
sen.cmt: 主語を削除しました。KesaをNokesaにしました。仁王会：サン・フレア用語集参照。
sen.e: Gave the imperial edict to build one hundred Koza (the stage on which a rakugo storyteller sits) and prepare one hundred nokesa (Buddhist stole), and held ninno-e (Buddhist ceremony of lecturing Ninnogyo [the Sutra of Benevolent Kings] to keep the nation tranquil).

sen.j: 皇太子（中大兄皇子）が初めて漏刻を作る。
sen.e: Prince (Naka no Oe no Oji) firstly made rokoku (water clock).
The crown prince (Naka no Oe no Oji) made the first rokoku (water clock).
sen.cmt: 冠詞を追加しました。Firstlyをfirstにし、移動しました。
sen.e: The crown prince (Naka no Oe no Oji) made the first rokoku (water clock).

sen.j: 阿倍比羅夫が夷50人余りを献じる。
sen.e: ABE no Hirafu presented about 50 Ezo people.
ABE no Hirafu presented about 50 Ezo people.
ABE no Hirafu presented about 50 Ezo people.

sen.j: 石上池のほとりに須弥山を作り、粛慎47人を饗応する。
sen.e: She made Mt. Sumeru near Ishigami Pond and wined and dined 47 Mishihase.
Erected Mt. Sumeru near Ishigami Pond and entertained 47 Mishihase people.
sen.cmt: 主語を削除しました。Madeをerectedにしました。Wined and dinedをentertainedにしました。Peopleを追加しました。
sen.e: Erected Mt. Sumeru near Ishigami Pond and entertained 47 Mishihase people.

sen.j: 国中の百姓が、訳もなく武器を持って道を往来する。
sen.e: Peasants across the country came and went on roads with weapons, but with no reason.
Peasants across the country came and went on the roads carrying weapons for no reason.
sen.cmt: 冠詞を追加しました。with~表現を変えました。
sen.e: Peasants across the country came and went on the roads carrying weapons for no reason.

tit.cmt: ピリオドを削除しました。

sen.j: - 賀取文らが帰る。
sen.e: - Gaesomun and so on came back to Japan.
- Gaesomun and his entourage returned to Japan.
sen.cmt: and so onをand his entourageに変えました。Came backをreturnedにしました。
sen.e: - Gaesomun and his entourage returned to Japan.

sen.j: 覩貨邏人の乾豆波斯達阿が帰国のための送使を求め、妻を留めて数十人と西海の路に入る。
sen.e: Genzuhashidachia, Tokara man, asked for the envoy in order to return home and made his wife stay and went in the road of Saikai.
sen.cmt: 「乾豆波斯達阿」を、Genzuhashidachiaとしました。
sen.e: Genzuhashidachia, a Tokara man, asked for an envoy in order to return home and, leaving his wife behind, went on his journey of the western seacoast with several dozen attendants.
sen.cmt: 原文の「とから」の漢字が違います。
sen.e: Genzuhashidachia, a Tokara man, asked for an envoy in order to return home and, leaving his wife behind, went on his journey of the western seacoast with several dozen attendants.

tit.cmt: ピリオドを削除しました。

sen.j: - 百済が唐と新羅に攻められて滅亡。
sen.e: - Kudara went to ruin, attacked by Tang and Shiragi.
- Attached by Silla and Tang, Baekje went to ruin.
sen.cmt: 名称を統一しました。英語として自然な順序に変えました。
sen.e: - Attached by Silla and Tang, Baekje went to ruin.

tit.cmt: ピリオドを削除しました。

sen.j: - 百済の建率の某と沙弥の覚従らが来て、鬼室福信が百済復興のために戦っていることを伝える。
sen.e: - Anonymous Kenritsu and Kakuju of Shami in Kudara came and told that Fukushin Kishitsu fought for the revival of Kudara.
- Kenritsu of Baekje and the priest Kakuju came and reported that Fukushin KISHITSU was fighting for the revival of Baekje.
sen.cmt: 氏を大文字にしました。Tellをreportにしました。時制を修正しました。建率の某、覚従の読み不明です。
sen.e: - Kenritsu of Baekje and the priest Kakuju came and reported that Fukushin KISHITSU was fighting for the revival of Baekje.

tit.cmt: ピリオドを削除しました。

sen.j: - 鬼室福信が貴智らを遣わして唐の俘百余人を献上し、援兵を求め、皇子の扶余豊璋の帰国を願う。
sen.e: - Fukushin Kishitsu sent Kichi and presented about 100 slaves of Tang, asked for enpei (reinforcements) and hoped for Price Buyeo Pung's returning home.
- Fukushin KISHITSU sent Kichi with about 100 Tang slaves as tribute, asking for reinforcements and the return of Prince Buyeo Pung.
sen.cmt: 氏を大文字にしました。自然な英語にしました。不要なローマ字表記は削除しました。
sen.e: - Fukushin KISHITSU sent Kichi with about 100 Tang slaves as tribute, asking for reinforcements and the return of Prince Buyeo Pung.

sen.j: 天皇は百済を助けるための出兵を命じ、また、礼を尽くして豊璋を帰国させるよう命じる。
sen.e: Emperor ordered dispatch of troops to help Kudara and respectfully ordered Pung to return home.
The empress dispatched troops to help Baekje and respectfully commissioned Pung to return home.
sen.cmt: Orderをcommissionにしました。前半から不要な部分を削除しました。
sen.e: The empress dispatched troops to help Baekje and respectfully commissioned Pung to return home.

tit.cmt: ピリオドを削除しました。

sen.j: - 軍器の準備のため、難波宮に行く。
sen.e: - She went to Naniwanomiya Palace for armament.
- Went to Naniwa no Miya Palace for armament.
sen.cmt: 主語を削除しました。名称を他の箇所と統一しました。
sen.e: - Went to Naniwa no Miya Palace for armament.

sen.j: 斉明天皇7年（661年）
sen.e: Emperor Saimei 7 (661).

tit.cmt: ピリオドを削除しました。

sen.j: - 西に向かって出航。
sen.e: - She shipped westward.
- Travelled west by ship.
sen.cmt: 自然な表現にしました。
sen.e: - Travelled west by ship.

tit.cmt: ピリオドを削除しました。

sen.j: - 大伯海に至る。
sen.e: - She arrived in Ookuno umi sea.
- Reached Ookuno Umi Sea.
- Reached Ookuno Umi Sea.

sen.j: 大田皇女が女を産み、大来皇女と名付ける。
sen.e: Ota no himemiko gave birth to a girl and named her Oku no himemiko.
Ota no himemiko gave birth to a girl and named her Oku no himemiko.
Ota no himemiko gave birth to a girl and named her Oku no himemiko.

tit.cmt: ピリオドを削除しました。

sen.j: - 伊予国の熟田津の石湯行宮に泊まる。
sen.e: - She stayed in Iwayu no karimiya palace in Nikitatsu, Iyo Province.
- Stayed at Iwayu no Karimiya Palace in Nikitatsu, Iyo Province.
sen.cmt: 主語を削除しました。Inをatにしました。名称を大文字にしました。
sen.e: - Stayed at Iwayu no Karimiya Palace in Nikitatsu, Iyo Province.

tit.cmt: ピリオドを削除しました。

sen.j: - 娜大津に着き、磐瀬行宮に居す。
sen.e: - She arrived in Na-no-otsu and stayed in Iwase-no-karimiya (Iwase-no-kari Palace).
- Arrived in Na no Otsu and stayed in Iwase no Karimiya Palace.
- Arrived in Na no Otsu and stayed in Iwase no Karimiya Palace.

sen.j: - 百済の福信が,使を遣わして王子の糺解の帰国を求める。
sen.e: - Fukushin of Kudara sent the envoy and asked for Prince Kuge's returning home.
- Fukushin of Kudara sent an envoy to ask for the return of Prince Kuge.
sen.cmt: 自然な表現にしました。
sen.e: - Fukushin of Kudara sent an envoy to ask for the return of Prince Kuge.

tit.cmt: ピリオドを削除しました。

sen.j: - 朝倉橘広庭宮に遷る。
sen.e: - She moved to Asakura no Tachibana no Hironiwa no Miya Palace.
- Moved to Asakura no Tachibana no Hironiwa no Miya Palace.
- Moved to Asakura no Tachibana no Hironiwa no Miya Palace.

tit.cmt: ピリオドを削除しました。

sen.j: - 耽羅が初めて王子の阿波伎らを遣わして貢献する。
sen.e: - Tanra firstly sent Prince Awagi and contributed.
- Tanra sent Prince Awagi to make their first tribute.
sen.cmt: 自然な表現にしました。
sen.e: - Tanra sent Prince Awagi to make their first tribute.

tit.cmt: ピリオドを削除しました。

sen.j: - 朝倉宮で崩御。
sen.e: - She passed away in Asakura Palace.
- Passed away in Asakura Palace.
- Passed away in Asakura Palace.

tit.cmt: ピリオドを削除しました。

sen.j: - 皇太子が天皇の喪に付き添い,磐瀬宮に着く。
sen.e: - Prince was in mourning for Emperor and arrived at Iwase Palace.
- The crown prince arrived at Iwase Palace for to mourn for the empress.
sen.cmt: 原文の句読点がコンマになってます。自然な表現にしました。
sen.e: - The crown prince arrived at Iwase Palace for to mourn for the empress.

tit.cmt: ピリオドを削除しました。

sen.j: - 天皇の喪が帰りの海路に出航。
sen.e: - The mourners for Emperor left by sea.
- The empress's mourners began their sea journey home.
sen.cmt: 自然な表現にしました。
sen.e: - The empress's mourners began their sea journey home.

tit.cmt: ピリオドを削除しました。

sen.j: - 天皇の喪が難波津に着く。
sen.e: - The mourners for Emperor arrived at Naniwa no Tsu (Naniwa Port).
- The empress's mourners arrived at Naniwa Port.
sen.cmt: 上文と同じスタイルにしました。
sen.e: - The empress's mourners arrived at Naniwa Port.

tit.cmt: ピリオドを削除しました。

sen.j: - 飛鳥の川原で殯した。
sen.e: - She was put in the coffin at the riverside of Asuka.
- She was put in the coffin at the side of Asuka River.
sen.cmt: At the riverside~をat the side of~としました。
sen.e: - She was put in the coffin at the side of Asuka River.

sen.j: 9日まで発哀。
sen.e: They cried for her until 9.
Mourners wailed for her until November 9.
sen.cmt: Novemberを追加しました。CryをWailにしました。
sen.e: Mourners wailed for her until November 9.

sen.j: 飛鳥時代（27代から37代）
sen.e: Asuka Period (from the twenty-seventh generation to the thirty-seventh generation).
Asuka Period (27th to 37th generations)
sen.cmt: ピリオドを削除しました。不要な部分を削除しました。
sen.e: Asuka Period (27th to 37th generations)

sen.j: 陵墓
sen.e: Ryobo (mausoleum).
Ryobo (mausoleum)
sen.cmt: ピリオドを削除しました。
sen.e: Ryobo (mausoleum)

sen.j: 越智崗上陵（おちのおかのえのみささぎ）に葬られたとされ、宮内庁により奈良県高市郡高取町大字車木にある車木ケンノウ古墳（円墳、直径約45メートル）が皇極・斉明天皇陵に指定されている。
sen.e: It is said that she was buried in Ochi no oka no eno misasagi, and Imperial Household Agency designated Kurumagi Kennou kofun (tumulus) (round barrow, the diameter about 45 meters) in Oaza, Kurumagi, Takatori-cho, Takaichi-gun, Nara Prefecture as an imperial mausoleum of Emperor Kogyoku and Emperor Saimei.

It is said that she was buried in Ochi no oka no eno misasagi, and the Imperial Household Agency has designated Kurumagi Kennou kofun (tumulus) (round barrow, approximate diameter 45 meters) in Oaza Kurumagi, Takatori Town, Takaichi County, Nara Prefecture an imperial mausoleum of Empress Kogyoku/Saimei.
sen.cmt: 冠詞を追加しました。時制を修正しました。Aboutをapproximateにしました。所在地を修正しました。天皇の名称を日本語と同じように記しました。
sen.e: It is said that she was buried in Ochi no oka no eno misasagi, and the Imperial Household Agency has designated Kurumagi Kennou kofun (tumulus) (round barrow, approximate diameter 45 meters) in Oaza Kurumagi, Takatori Town, Takaichi County, Nara Prefecture an imperial mausoleum of Empress Kogyoku/Saimei.

sen.j: 但し、研究者の間では明日香村の岩屋山古墳、同村の牽牛子塚古墳、橿原市の小谷古墳も陵墓の候補としてあげられている。
sen.e: However, some researchers say that there are Iwayayama-kofun Tumulus in Asuka-mura, Kengoshizuka Tomb in the same village and Kotani Tomb in Kashihara City as the candidates for Ryobo.

However, some researchers have suggested Iwayayama-kofun Tumulus in Asuka Village, Kengoshizuka Tomb also in Asuka Village and Kotani Tomb in Kashihara City as possible candidates for the empress's Ryobo.
sen.cmt: 自然な表現にしました。
sen.e: However, some researchers have suggested Iwayayama-kofun Tumulus in Asuka Village, Kengoshizuka Tomb also in Asuka Village and Kotani Tomb in Kashihara City as possible candidates for the empress's Ryobo.

Father: Chinu no Okimi.

Imperial Palaces: Asuka Itabuki no Miya Palace, Asuka no Kawahara no Miya Palace, Nochi no Asuka Okamoto no Miya Imperial Residence.

Reign: Four years (as Empress Kogyoku), seven years as Empress Saimei

sen.e: Reign: Four years (as Empress Kogyoku), seven years as Empress Saimei

She died in 661 (at the age of 68).
